methods.title: debug()
methods.description: Allows for logging in Spektral.js. When not called, using Spektral.log() will not log in console. Can be used outside of Spektral.js instead of console.log.

methods.title: about()
methods.description: Shows in the console which version of Spektral.js you are using, and what mode it is in. (debug or release)

methods.title: attachEventListener()
methods.description: Attaches an event listener to any element. If a mouse event, the hand (pointer) cursor is automatically applied.

params.eventTarget: Accepts element or string (will use getElement() if string).

params.eventType: Accepts any valid event type, ex. 'click', 'complete', 'load'. Also accepts custom event types.

params.eventHandler: The function you wish to use to handle the event when it is fired.

methods.title: detachEventListener()
methods.description: Detaches an event listener from any element. If a mouse event, the hand cursor is automatically set back to default.

params.eventTarget: Accepts element or string (will use getElement() if string).

params.eventType: Accepts any valid event type, ex. 'click', 'complete', 'load'. Also accepts custom event types.

params.eventHandler: The function you wish to use to handle the event when it is fired.
